createUUID () String public static

Defined in js/util/StringUtil.js:147

Creates a universally unique identifier.

Returns:

String:

Example:

 StringUtil.createUUID();
 // 'a95d7134-3342-4001-bcea-cc0371b70dec'

format
(
  • str
  • ...rest
)
String public static

Defined in js/util/StringUtil.js:251

Replaces each format item in a specified string with the text equivalent of a corresponding object's value.

Parameters:

  • str String
  • ...rest Array

Returns:

String:

Example:

 StringUtil.format('Robert is {0}. Very {0} and {1}!', 'cool', 'smart');
 // 'Robert is cool. Very cool and smart!'

getExtension
(
  • filename
  • withDot
)
String public static

Defined in js/util/StringUtil.js:32

Gets the extension name off the string being passed in.

Parameters:

  • filename String
  • withDot Boolean

    If you want the period to be included in the extension name.

Returns:

String:

Example:

 StringUtil.getExtension('file.exe');
 // 'exe'

 StringUtil.getExtension('file.exe', true);
 // '.exe'

paramReplace
(
  • queryString
  • name
  • value
)
String | Void

Defined in js/util/StringUtil.js:277

Updates a value in the query string by its key name.

Parameters:

  • queryString Object
  • name Object
  • value Object

Returns:

String | Void:

Example:

 StringUtil.paramReplace('?name=Robert&age=23&gender=male', 'gender', 'female');
 // '?name=Robert&age=23&gender=female'

queryStringToObject
(
  • queryString
  • [useParseFloat=true]
)
Object | Null public static

Defined in js/util/StringUtil.js:166

Converts a query string to an object.

Parameters:

  • queryString String
  • [useParseFloat=true] Boolean optional

Returns:

Object | Null:

Example:

 StringUtil.queryStringToObject('?name=Robert&age=23&gender=male');
 // {name: 'Robert', age: 23, gender: 'male'}

 StringUtil.queryStringToObject('?name=Robert&age=23&gender=male', false);
 // {name: 'Robert', age: '23', gender: 'male'}

removeAllWhitespace
(
  • str
)
String public static

Defined in js/util/StringUtil.js:200

Remove all whitespace from the string passed in.

Parameters:

  • str String

Returns:

String:

Example:

 var str = '   a b    c d e f g ';
 StringUtil.removeAllWhitespace(str);
 // 'abcdefg'

String public static

Remove leading and trailing whitespace.

Parameters:

  • str String

Returns:

String:

Example:

 var str = '   a b    c d e f g ';
 StringUtil.removeLeadingTrailingWhitespace(str);
 // 'a b    c d e f g'

toPascalCase
(
  • str
)
String public static

Defined in js/util/StringUtil.js:112

Converts a hyphen string to a pascal case string.

Parameters:

  • str String

Returns:

String:

Example:

 StringUtil.toPascalCase("liveDown_by-the.River");
 // 'LiveDownByTheRiver'

toSentence
(
  • str
  • [separator]
)
String public static

Defined in js/util/StringUtil.js:53

Converts a string to a sentence case string.

Parameters:

  • str String
  • [separator] String optional

    Can be any string you want to use as a separator.

Returns:

String:

Example:

 StringUtil.toSentence("liveDown_by-the.River");
 // 'live down by the river'

 StringUtil.toSentence("liveDown_by-the.River", '-');
 // 'live-down-by-the-river'

 StringUtil.toSentence("liveDown_by-the.River", '_');
 // 'live_down_by_the_river'

 StringUtil.toSentence("liveDown_by-the.River", '/');
 // 'live/down/by/the/river'

truncate
(
  • text
  • length
)
String public static

Defined in js/util/StringUtil.js:232

Parameters:

  • text String
  • length Int

Returns:

String:

Example:

  StringUtil.truncate('Robert is cool and he likes bruschetta.', 14));
  // 'Robert is cool...'
